name: muhlenbergia glomerata
description: Marsh Muhly actively grows during the summer when soil temperatures are warm and spreads by rhizomes.  Other common names in use include Spiked Muhly.
features: Deer Resistant (Our experiences here in the Upper Midwest may vary in other regions; deer can respond differently to local conditions or seasonal variations.)
Recommended for home landscaping but potentially aggressive; could overwhelm small landscapes
